conclusion: The change in direction of illumination alters the shape and position of the shadows.
Since the light source moves to the right, the shadows will shift to the left of the objects.
The proximity of the light source to the objects influences the size of the shadows.
As the light source moves closer, the shadows will become larger.
As the light source moves further away, the shadows will shrink.
The shadows A, B, C, and D will move to the left and may enlarge or reduce in size depending on the distance of the light source from the objects.
The light source moves to the right, above the objects.
The shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift to the left of the objects.
The size of the shadows will change based on the distance of the light source from the objects.
If the light source moves closer, the shadows will become larger.
If the light source moves further away, the shadows will become smaller.
Thus, the shadows will move to the left and may change in size depending on the distance of the light source from the objects.
